April 2022 County of Marin EMS E 2
COLD INDUCED INJURY
Indications
• Exposure to cold or wet environment
Move to a warm, protected area ASAP
Signs of life No signs of life
• Start warming measures;
handle gently
If submersion ≤1 hour If submersion ≥1 hour
• Obtain rectal temp • Determination of death
If ALOC
• Obtain rectal temp
Begin transport
If rectal temp <95°F * If rectal temp >95°F
Warming measures • Initiate warming • Follow appropriate
measures protocol according
• Remove all wet clothing
• Follow appropriate to patient’s cardiac
• Cover entire body with
protocol according to rhythm
warm blankets
patient’s cardiac
• Apply hot packs
rhythm
• Warm IV fluids
• Immediately transport
Symptoms
• Mild: shivering, increased
RR & HR
• Moderate/Severe: ALOC,
slurred speech, unsteady
gait, slow HR & RR, low
BP, (ventricular)
dysrhythmias
Special Consideration
• Subtler presentations
exist in elderly, newborns,
chronically ill and
* Withhold ACLS meds if temp <86°F
alcoholics
